H0.text: Jet streams are fast moving rivers of air that are going in opposite directions.

H1.text: Air streams are fast-moving rivers of air that are going in opposite directions.

H2.text: Cause streams are fast moving rivers of air that are going in opposite directions.

H3.text: Burst streams are fast moving rivers of air that are going in opposite directions.

A4.text: Jet streams may start, stop, split into two or more parts, combine into one stream, or flow in various directions including opposite to the direction of the remainder of the jet.

A5.text: The main jet streams are located near the altitude of the tropopause and are westerly winds, flowing west to east around the globe.
